intro: Poterium mauretanicum, commonly known as the Moroccan spurge, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has a shallow root system that helps it conserve water efficiently. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
